review: The photos that I've downloaded off the app randomly keep disappearing from my gallery. I didn't delete any of those. It's happened twice now, and the resplash folder is the only one from where the photos disappear. I think I had 50 or so pictures the last time I checked, I'm only left with about half of that number now? Not sure if there's something wrong with the app, but it doesn't happen to any of the other media on my phone. Any help would be appreciated.
ras4vb: Hi Abhinav, please try the latest version v3.0.2. This issue should be fixed. Thanks!

review: Awesome app. Would be useful to have a 'next wallpaper' homescreen shortcut (or an app shortcut, like the one already present for 'search') for skipping the current wallpaper fetched by auto wallpaper. The button is present in the auto wallpaper menu but it's tedious to open the app and go to the auto wallpaper menu to change the wallpaper every time. Edit: Thanks for the reply. Quick settings tile works fine for me. üëç
ras4vb: Hi Abishek, glad to hear that you are liking the app. Currently there is a quick settings tile that can be added to your notification drawer that will skip the current wallpaper. Let me know if that works for you or if you need any help enabling it üòä

review: Update: this app doesn't yet have a material you icon for Android 13. Original: Auto wallpaper sets more frequently than the user specified interval, and the search terms are searching every word individually even without a comma separator. Other than that I'm loving the md2 redesign and the auto wallpaper feature. I'm definitely using the app a lot more now.
ras4vb: Hi Aaron, auto wallpaper is affected by Android Doze which tries to optimize background tasks to save battery. You can try and disable battery optimizations for Resplash if you want it to change closer to the specified interval. Also search terms without commas might just be working coincidentally depending on the terms. I hope that helps.

review: I would give it 5 stars if not for one small bug/problem. The auto wallpaper. In my experience it does not work, no matter the conditions I turn on. But besides that little bug/problem, I do love the app. Has a nice UI (even has dark & black [amoled] themes), it's fast (depending on your network) and it's really well organized. Keep up the good work!

So, I LOVE the website. I wanted to download it on my phone so it would be easier to look at, but I have an android. My roommate has the iphone version, and it is 10x better! It has categories, is easy to use and shows the pictures so well. My version doesn't have categories, and it shows the same pictures every single time I get on there. So if I want to look at something new, I have to search for it, which is difficult sometimes. PLEASE put in categories for android users. It's WAY better.
ras4vb: Hi Katlyn, unfortunately Unsplash doesn't allow third party applications like Resplash to access these categories. Unless Unsplash decides to allow this functionality, there isn't much I can do. Sorry üò≠

review: I love the new design and the new features with this update! However I noticed an issue in regards to individual profile. When I'm trying to add an account in the app, it redirects me to the browser page, and after putting my login and password it logs me in the browser, but doesn't register or login in the Resplash app. Maybe it can be fixed with the next update.
ras4vb: Hi! Sorry to hear that you are seeing this issue, send an email to whoisbrandonlam@gmail.com and I can try to help you out there.

review: This doesn't really work well as a mobile app. It isn't because it's bad, it's the fact that their library has a pretty small percentage of images suitable for mobile wallpapers They just aren't the correct resolutions. You'll easily spend many minutes scrolling just to find an image the proper size, or even orientation, then good luck if it's something you like. For desktop wallpapers though, amazing selection. But this isn't a desktop app.

Edit: This app is great but it seems to have a bug. It crashes and says oops something went wrong during downloads. Then I have to clear the memory and log back in to continue. It happens almost daily. Please fix this. This is a great app! I need royalty free pictures as I paint them for my blog and youtube so I find this app very helpful as I can easily download them via mobile

Only one thing missing: on replash Pro, you can select search terms for the Auto Wallpaper, which is very nice. The only thing I would highly suggest is that you add a ''blocked'' terms for thing that you dont want as a wallpaper. By example, I am uncomfortable to have somebody's portrait as a wallpaper when I dont know that person. I also don't want to have food as a wallpaper and other things like that :) Im sure I am not the only one though. Overall, the app is great, better than IG!
ras4vb: Hey Moxie, that's a great idea! I'll see what I can do about that. It will most likely rely on the tags that are in the photo so I can't guarantee that all blocked terms will be filtered out but it should catch most of them. üôÇ

review: Over a million RAW wallpapers, yet no ads to be seen. I've been trying to find an application to collect images with, but most of them are bombarded with ads. Well, what do you know. I ended with Unsplash. Frankly, my PS4 wallpapers came from the site itself, and having a mobile app to easily browse the amazing array of images from there to my phone is such a nice feature! Great job on Resplash! üòÅüëçüèª

I downloaded the app only for the daily wallpapers. The wallpapers have very sharp resolution and great quality. The daily wallpaper feature is great, except that the app starts the 24 (or 48, and other options) hour count from the time you enable the feature. In other words, you do not get to choose when during the day you want the wallpaper to be replaced. If you enabled the feature at three o'clock in the afternoon, it will automatically replace your wallpaper everyday at three o'clock.

Grate app but .... I don't think it's fully compatible with android 12 yet . Don't get me wrong it's the best collection of photo walpers out their . The Auto wallpaper feature which is a premium feature constantly crashes it'll work for two or three hours sometimes sometimes it'll work for half an hour once in awhile work for a day but it always crashes and then often you have to restart the phone get it to work again. Other than that grate app .

Great app and thank you for adding the parallax effect! The only thing missing now is an optimised wallpaper sourcing. Moxie's idea of sourcing featured wallpapers with a keyword blacklist seems to be the easiest solution to this problem. Edit: selecting a few collections does a good job as well and since the developer is extremely kind and helpful, I had to give it 5 stars now. You're awesome Brandon!
ras4vb: Hey Armin, I did some investigating and the way that I wanted to implement blacklist it is currently impossible because the Unsplash API doesn't support it. I've contacted their team and they said that they would consider it but can't do it on a whim since it affects everyone using the API. So unfortunately this is out of my hands for now üò¢

review: I love this app! It has a nice minimalistic design, with really beautiful high quality photos. Images menu is nicely hidden, viewable thru the pop up button. The menu also has a beautiful minimalistic design where you can chose to download, share, set as wallpaper, etc. the photo. The search bar makes it easy to quickly find images being searched. Overall, great app!

Great app but auto wallpaper feature is buggy. Seems to get stuck on wallpapers (I.e. you set it to change every 3 hours and it'll stay the same until you restart the phone or manually change wallpaper); viewing wallpaper history the app thinks it's set wallpapers that actually haven't been set. It's also slightly unintuitive to set wallpaper manually. Given most options for the picture are directly underneath it (favourite, etc), it's odd to then have the 'set wallpaper' hidden in arrow button

Edited: The app is great and simple to use, I assumed that the pro version would be without ads, but they aren't too intrusive so that's fine Original:Not sure why but I still get Ads even after buying the app, the dell sponsored post still shows up as the first one
ras4vb: Hi Abdullah, the sponsored posts are coming directly from Unsplash. As a third party app, I have no control over what content gets shown. Resplash doesn't have any ads itself nor is removing ads a feature of Resplash Pro. Sorry for any misunderstanding

review: I love the app for the most part but there's a few issues. on Samsung phones with the gestures enabled, the navigation bar is white when dark mode and the dark theme is enabled. also when selecting a photo, the download button is too high to reach comfortably. the set as wallpaper is too big on the bottom & the download option should be there. edit: developer responded. the long press is very useful for downloading, didn't know about it before. samsung gesture bar issue isn't a huge deal
ras4vb: Hi Hassan, thanks for letting me know about these issues, I'll look into them and hopefully fix them in the next update. Just wanted to let you know that you can also long press on a photo to download it which should hopefully help with reachability. Also the set wallpaper button should shrink automatically when you scroll. I hope that helps!

review: Edit: I disabled battery optimization for the app and it seems to work now. Great app for a great platform. However, I seem to be unable to have it set a new wallpaper on the interval I specify. It is set to change every 3 hours, but it changes almost immediately.

I have always been on the lookout for the coolest wallpapers. There are a bunch of apps in the market and I have tried many of them. But this app is totally amazing. The abundance and the variety is breathtaking. Even the ad placements are such that they are totally non intrusive and don't look wierd. Highly recommended. Great job dev.üëç

Great set of wallpapers. Although, there are some features like auto change wallpaper not functioning properly. That's why only 3 stars. Edit: Disabling battery optimization fixed the issue. A propmt response from the developer shows how much they care about the customer feedback. Great job guys.
ras4vb: Hi Sankalp, can you try unchecking the Idle and Charging conditions to see if that helps? Additionally disable any kind of battery optimizations for Resplash because it can cause issues with the background service running auto wallpaper. I hope that helps :)

review: Love this app and the update is fantastic! It's such a great way to see and share photos and, my main use, find some amazing wallpapers for my phone. The only addition I'd like to see is making it so that the navigation bar is fully transparent and not a solid color when using gesture navigation on Android 10/11.

Great wallpapers, simple design. Works well other than the auto wallpaper changer. It doesn't change when its supposed to so I have to to click the button to do it manually. Edit: the Dev updated the app an hour after my review so thst there's a quick settings tile to change the wallpaper. Makes things way easier. Thanks!!
ras4vb: Hey Matthew, you read my mind! An update is rolling out right now that adds a quick settings tile to the notification drawer that will set a new wallpaper. üòÄ

review: Fantastic app - best auto-changing wallpaper one I've used. Plus it showcases the quality photographic talent of Unsplash. The quick-change/notification panel button makes changing the wallpaper a fast and easy task. Includes a paid option to choose collections as an auto source - an important feature which was really the only thing previously missing! Great work on a great app, dev.
ras4vb: Hi Tom, glad to hear that you are liking Resplash! I'm not sure what you mean by notification panel button but there is a quick settings tile that can be added to go to the next wallpaper. Let me know if you need help adding that.

username: That Gum Is Climbing Out of Your Mouth
review: Please add an option to to customize the images that are shown to you on the home screen. I don't want to keep looking selfies and random pictures of people.

Does the job elegantly, but is limited in options. The search function didn't show in the Auto Wallpaper feature (the main feature), so it feels like you have just 5 source photo choices! A slideshow feature would be good too, it feels like a glaring omission.

I honestly like everything about the app - easy to navigate, set up auto wallpaper and its sources (collections/terms). The only feature I'd really like this app to have is some kind of face recognition and omitting those images. I do not enjoy having unknown people/faces as my phone wallpapers. To the developers - please include this feature, I'd gladly pay extra for it.

Wonderfully designed and smooth app. It's a great source for all the wallpapers you could want. One thing I'd like to see the developer add is the ability to have auto wallpaper draw from one album when the device has light mode enabled, and from another album when dark mode is on.

I love the wallpapers listed here. My 2 problems are - 1. Automaticlly changing wallpaper not working for me. 2. Set wallpaper action is taking more than 30 seconds every time. Edit- Added 1* just for your reply. I tried the option you shared. No difference. I saw the wallpaper getting changed one time while unchecking all boxes. But nothing after that even though the interval i set is passed. Also,Do i get a crop option. Every tym i set a wallpaper for lock screen, its not the portion i want.
ras4vb: Hi Renjith, try unchecking the Idle and Charging conditions to see if that helps? Additionally disable any kind of battery optimizations for Resplash because it can cause issues with the auto wallpaper background service. You can try lowering the "Wallpaper Quality" in the settings to speed things up. I hope that helps :)

review: I love this app! It looks great and works great! Very convenient and useful! 5/5 stars would recommend! I am having an issue with the auto wallpaper feature though. It crashes my phone whenever I try to use it. I have an Alcatel OneTouch Allura and am using Evie Launcher. Would appreciate if you could offer some advice or fix it.

Great photos great clarity and decent features with the auto wallpaper thing...but the lock screen wallpapers are hardly ever the correct screen ratio. They look distorted and it ruins the whole experience. If this issue gets fixed, it'd be an ideal wallpaper app

Installed with wallpaper autochange enabled by default, plaguing me daily with a random succession of some very dreary images that I wouldn't have chosen for myself in a month of Sundays. No notification that the wallpaper had been changed, so tracking down the culprit took some time. So app did something I didn't want and didn't like, and nor could I stop it without some effort on my part. Hence 1 star.
ras4vb: Hi Nigel, sorry to hear that you experienced this issue! But I can assure you that auto wallpaper is not enabled by default (otherwise you would think that more people would complain but this is the first time that I'm hearing of this). I hope that you'll reconsider, feel free to reach out to whoisbrandonlam@gmail.com with any concerns üôÇ

review: Great app! One question though: Is there a way to set the auto wallpaper to only access specific collections? Edit: Wow, that was a lightning fast reply! Great news, thanks for the update! Now that that's answered let me just tell you that I looove your app. It's just beautifully designed, truly stands out among this bunch of other Android garbage. Never had any problems with it.
ras4vb: Hi Konrad, this is a feature I'm currently working on! Hopefully I'll be able to release it in the near future üòÑ

review: Great app. My only recommendation is that there should be some kind of report functionality if there isn't one already. There are quite a few images of a transaction via square reader occurring. Either this is the greasiest ad campaign or ya'll know about it and are getting the bag.
ras4vb: Hey Alex, you can contact support@unsplash.com to report inappropriate content. In the case of the "Square" images, I do believe that this is part of an ad campaign run by Unsplash. Unfortunately Resplash is just a third party app that pulls images from Unsplash and we don't have control over the content that they give us. Hope that helps üòä

review: Easy to use. Does what it says, gives you an easy and fast way to navigate Unsplash for wallpapers, and set them with a click. Allows you to save the pictures to your own Unsplash collections, so you can find them later.

Great app. Personally as photographer, I get inspired a lot. A small suggestion - can you keep log of downloaded pictures, because me personally felt it's double work to dowload and save again. So if there is a list of downloaded items, that will be automatically saved in my profile. Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è

Sometimes there are duplicate photos on the home section, otherwise nice app! Edit: The new version is way more smoother and I'm loving it! But the duplicate photos are still there, although i feel they're less frequent. Thanks for the nice app!
ras4vb: Hi Farzad, please try the latest version v3.0.2 and let me know if your issue has been fixed. Thanks!

review: Great app. One issue though, when I tapped the Floating Action Button, it asked me to choose between chrome and the app, and I chose the app and set it as default. Now Everytime I tap that button it opens chrome and reopens the app. Nothing else happens other than the app getting reloaded.
ras4vb: Hi Nithin, that issue should be fixed in an update soon. That button should open the browser and direct you to the upload page but Resplash is also setup to open links from Unsplash which is why it is directing you back to the app. I would recommend resetting "Open by default" settings for Resplash and choosing Chrome instead. I hope that helps üòä

review: Really great app, makes me have the best of unsplash. One thing I strongly would like to see in the app, is the option of adding photos in a collection, so that I dont have to jump to the web version every time. Regards.

Amazing app. Love the quick tile for changing the wallpaper. A few suggestions. Please add an option where the user can add the collection or an artist as the source of the wallpapers. Also for the launchers like Pixel launchers, if there are more than 1 page on the home screen then, the wallpaper is not centered for the home page. For this, please add an option for horizontal wallpaper fix so that the wallpapers are always centered.

Great implementation of Unsplash. I was looking for a customizable app that would let me use keywords or custom categories to change my Pixel 3's wallpaper every hour or so and this does exactly that. The navigation makes sense and is highly easy to use.
